name: Wall Closure Checklist 1 Rough In [A]
Wall Closure Checklist 1 Rough In
Confirm area of work is accessible & acceptable to commence (If not comment below)
FCU installed in right location as per mechanical layout and the model number is in accordance with latest AC schedule
FCU installed at right height to ensure grille is centred into the bulkhead & 5% slope towards drain point
Thermostat control cabling has been installed
Thermostat location is correct as per RCP
Drains have been run to Tundish
Drains tested and witnessed by Broad Air
All wiring including interconection wiring to condenser & branch box are roughed without defect
Refrigeration pipes have been installed and all refnets are sealed and hard to soffit and don’t impede on ceiling height
Refrigeration insulation is not damaged. Refrigeration pipe supports have been installed maximum 2m apart
Where refrigeration lines insulated and supported pipe clamps have been installed to avoid damage to insulation
Exhaust Vent & Make up Air boxes are installed as per drawings and sealed

All FCU flexible ducts installed and supported by intact load spreader
All flexible ducts connections to air terminals and spigots have been air tight & secured by using fixing ties/cables ties & duct tape

Sheetmetal attenuating ductwork has been installed as per documented drawings
Ventilation:
Ventilation
Inspection Date:
Fans installed within ceiling areas are in the correct location as per Mechanical Drawings
Fans Installed correctly with rubber isolation pads
All Flex has been run to correct location
All flex are hung independent of other services and supported by intact load spreaders
All flexible ducts inner core and outer core have been mechanically secured & taped to spigots and air terminals by using duct tape & fixing/cable ties?
All flexible ducts have been mechanically secured to spigots and air terminals by using fixing ties
Flexible ducts run on the right location and not jammed?
Butterfly dampers are installed to the fan as per mechanical drawings and they are in a fully opened position and air tight sealed
PVC sleeves has been installed in wet area walls
PVC ducts have been hung and supported indicidually by using hanging straps
Flatpack flexible joiner connected to façade & installed air tight & water tight as per mechanical drawings
Fresh air to apartment including fire dampers & non return dampers installed as per drawings

Material:

Are the attenuator splitters in the plane of the bend ?
Are transitions close to attenuators gradual?
Is a settling duct between volume control dampers and attenuators allowed?
Are fire dampers installed and break away joint complete
Are flexible ducts installed, supported and connected to spigot by approved method using duct tape on internal core and cable tie on outer core
Are flexible connections to equipment sealed and aligned
Is ductwork insulation as per drawings
Is ductwork fire rating complete
Are all spigots installed and dampers fully open
Are all access panels for fire damper access installed and closed
Is ductwork installation complete

A/C Checklist Commissioning [F]
A/C Checklist Commissioning
Refrigeration lines have been pressurised and have maintained pressure for more than 24hrs?
Refrigerant lines have been vacuumed to 500 microns and maintained the vacuum?
Indoor unit drains have been terminated to the tundish point?
Outdoor unit drains have been terminated to the tundish point?
Indoor unit flare connection has been properly insulated with specified insulation?
Indoor unit drain connection point has been securely fastened and sealed?
A/C System Flows checked as per mechanical drawings
Ventilation Checklist Commissioning [G]
Ventilation Checklist Commissioning
Fan has been tested and is operational?
Adequate flow has been achieved in bathroom 1?
Adequate flow has been achieved in ensuite?
Adequate flow has been achieved in laundry?
Range hood has been tested and is operational?
Fire Damper Checklist [H]
Fire Damper Checklist
Penetration details have been captured
Gaps between the fire damper and wall no greater than 25mm and is filled with Lorient Intumescent Sealant with no cracking visible
Lorient fire rated mastic has been applied to entire perimeter of fire damper cell on both sides. No evidence of cracking.
Casing perimeter is sealed with Lorient intumescent sealant. No evidence of cracking.
Mechanically fix the branch to the vertical riser with steel screws or pop rivets
Sheet metal thickness is 0.7mm or greater.
Ductwork is connected to either side of the casing with nylon bolts on the flanges as per the AS1682.2 break away joint method. Bolts do not exceed an 8mm diameter.
Access panel is provided to conveniently access fire damper for visual and/or maintenance inspections.
Fire damper labelling in accordance with AS1682.2 has been placed and clearly identifies the fire damper
Pictures attached
Signature (Contract/Subcontractor Assessor)
Signature (Builder Representative)
Smoke Damper Checklist [I]
Smoke Damper Checklist
Smoke damper must be placed in the duct work so the closed blades are with 610 mm of the smoke barrier and before any duct inlets or outlets (See photo attached)

When joining or fastening the damper to duct work, dampers shall be fastened with M6 bolts or M5 screws. Fasteners shall be spaced a maximum of 305 mm center to center with a minimum of two fastners per side.

Smoke dampers must be sealed between the damper frames and duct work. The sealant shall be pressed in place to dispel any air and shall be applied to one side of the damper's face. Use the minimum amount of the material to completely seal the joint.
Access Panel for Actuator and wiring according code and regulations
